task: The function $g$ is defined by $ g(x) = 4x - 5 $. What is the value of $ g(x) $ when $ x = 3 $?
explanation:
Choice D is correct. The value of $ g(x) $ when $ x = 3 $ can be found by substituting 3 for $x$ in the given equation $ g(x) = 4x - 5 $. 
This yields $ g(3) = 4(3) + -5 $, or $ g(3) = 7 $. Therefore, when $ x = 3 $, the value of $ g(x) $ is $ 7 $.
